nodes.bodyText:
I'm thinking we should stay consistent and utilize JS Doc {@link
this comment applies to all comments which have had this tag removed.
Some of the Java doc comments have been modified to be independent of HAPI FHIR data model version to be available as a common component for both BFD v1 and BFD v2.
I would suggest we keep using JS Doc {@link to be consistent with other comments. The same comment applies to all changed comments in this PR.
Can you highlight the reason for this change? I imagine it's to ignore cleanup errors, but why is this needed all of a sudden?

To address Javadoc doclint. It was failing the build if all the doclint criteria's were not met. Not sure how it was being subdued before but it started cropping up. We can always come back and revisit this if needed.
Were you still wanting to rename this, CCWProcedure?
same applies to all comments where the JS Doc {@link tag was removed.
